SENT.plain: Behçet's disease (BD) is a systemic inflammatory vascular disease with several clinical manifestations and geographical differences in disease expression
In Middle Eastern countries it is one of the most common causes of cerebral venous thrombosis
We report a 29-year-old female admitted for acute headache and vomiting
A magnetic resonance image showed a large thrombosis of sagital and transverse sinuses
She developed oral and genital ulcers a week later
Ophthalmologic examination revealed left anterior uveitis and ipsilateral papilledema
Multiple studies ruled out a hypercoagulability syndrome
A biopsy of a genital ulcer demonstrated diffuse lymphocytic infiltration with vasculitis
After treatment with topical and systemic corticoids, her condition improved
Venous sinus thrombosis followed by oral and genital ulcers is an unusual presentation of Behçet's disease
